==Events==
* [[307]] &ndash; Emperor [[Flavius Valerius Severus|Severus II]] is captured and imprisoned at [[Three Taverns|Tres Tabernae]]. He is later executed (or forced to commit [[suicide]]) after [[Galerius]] unsuccessfully invades Italy.
*[[1400]] &ndash; [[Owain Glyndŵr]] is declared [[Prince of Wales]] by his followers.
*[[1620]] &ndash; The ''[[Mayflower]]'' starts her voyage to North America
*[[1701]] &ndash; [[James Francis Edward Stuart]], sometimes called the "Old Pretender", becomes the [[Jacobitism|Jacobite claimant]] to the thrones of England and Scotland.
*[[1776]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: the [[Battle of Harlem Heights]] is fought.
*[[1779]] &ndash; American Revolutionary War: The Franco-American [[Siege of Savannah]] begins.
*[[1795]] &ndash; The first occupation by United Kingdom of [[Cape Colony]], South Africa with the Battle of Hout Bay, after successive victories at the [[Battle of Muizenberg]] and Wynberg, after [[William V of Orange|William V]] requested protection against revolutionary France's occupation of the Netherlands.
*[[1810]] &ndash; With the ''[[Grito de Dolores]],'' [[Priest|Father]] [[Miguel Hidalgo]] begins [[Mexican War of Independence|Mexico's fight for independence from Spain]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; The [[Fire of Moscow (1812)|Fire of Moscow]] begins shortly after midnight and destroys three quarters of the city days later.
*[[1863]] &ndash; [[Robert College]] of [[Istanbul]]-[[Turkey]], the first American educational institution outside the United States, is founded by [[Christopher Robert]], an American philanthropist.
*[[1880]] &ndash; ''[[The Cornell Daily Sun]]'' prints its first issue in [[Ithaca, New York]]. The ''Sun'' is the nation's oldest, continuously-independent college daily.
*[[1893]] &ndash; Settlers make a [[Land Run of 1893|land run]] for prime land in the [[Cherokee Outlet|Cherokee Strip]] in [[Oklahoma]].
*[[1908]] &ndash; The [[General Motors Corporation]] is founded.
*[[1919]] &ndash; The [[American Legion]] is incorporated.
*[[1920]] &ndash; The [[Wall Street bombing]]: a bomb in a horse wagon explodes in front of the [[23 Wall Street|J. P. Morgan building]] in New York City &ndash; 38 are killed and 400 injured.
*[[1928]] &ndash; The [[1928 Okeechobee hurricane|Okeechobee hurricane]] strikes southeastern [[Florida]], killing upwards of 2,500 people. It is the third deadliest natural disaster in United States history, behind the [[Galveston hurricane of 1900]] and the [[1906 San Francisco earthquake]]. 
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Kingdom of Italy|Italian]] troops [[Italian invasion of Egypt|conquer Sidi Barrani]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; World War II: Concerned that [[Rezā Shāh|Reza Pahlavi]], the [[Shah of Iran]], is about to ally his petroleum-rich empire with [[Nazi Germany]], the United Kingdom and the [[Soviet Union]] [[Anglo-Soviet Invasion of Iran|invade Iran]] in late August and force the Shah to abdicate in favor of his son, [[Mohammad Reza Pahlavi]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: The [[Allied invasion of Italy]] concludes when [[Heinrich von Vietinghoff]], commander of the [[10th Army (Wehrmacht)|German Tenth Army]], orders his troops to withdraw from [[Salerno]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; World War II: The surrender of the Japanese troops in Hong Kong is accepted by [[Royal Navy]] Admiral Sir [[Cecil Harcourt]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; Typhoon Kathleen hits [[Saitama, Saitama|Saitama]], Tokyo and [[Tone River]] area, at least 1,930 killed.
*[[1955]] &ndash; The military coup to unseat President [[Juan Perón]] of Argentina is launched at midnight.
*  1955   &ndash; A [[Soviet Navy]] [[Zulu class submarine]] becomes the first submarine to launch a [[ballistic missile]]. 
*[[1959]] &ndash; The first successful [[photocopier]], the [[Xerox 914]], is introduced in a demonstration on live television from [[New York City]].
*[[1961]] &ndash; The United States [[National Hurricane Research Project]] drops eight cylinders of [[silver iodide]] into the eyewall of [[Hurricane Esther]]. Wind speed reduces by 10%, giving rise to [[Project Stormfury]].
*[[1963]] &ndash; [[Malaysia]] is formed from the [[Federation of Malaya]], [[Singapore]], [[North Borneo]] ([[Sabah]]) and [[Crown Colony of Sarawak|Sarawak]]. However, Singapore soon leaves this new country.
*[[1966]] &ndash; The [[Metropolitan Opera House (Lincoln Center)|Metropolitan Opera House]] opens at [[Lincoln Center]] in New York City with the world premiere of [[Samuel Barber]]'s [[opera]], ''[[Antony and Cleopatra (opera)|Antony and Cleopatra]]''.
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[King Hussein]] of [[Jordan]] declares military rule following the hijacking of four civilian airliners by the [[Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine]] (PFLP). This results in the formation of the [[Black September (group)|Black September]] [[Palestinian people|Palestinian]] paramilitary unit.
*[[1971]] &ndash; [[Typhoon Nancy (1961)|Typhoon Nancy]], with possibly the strongest winds ever measured in a [[tropical cyclone]], makes landfall in [[Osaka]], Japan, killing 173 people.
*[[1975]] &ndash; [[Papua New Guinea]] gains its independence from Australia.
*  1975   &ndash; The [[Cape Verde Islands]], [[Mozambique]], and [[Sao Tome and Principe]] join the [[United Nations]].
*  1975   &ndash; The first prototype of the [[MiG-31]] interceptor makes its maiden flight.
*[[1976]] &ndash; [[Shavarsh Karapetyan]] saves 20 people from the trolleybus that had fallen into [[Erevan]] [[reservoir]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; An earthquake measuring 7.5 to 7.9 on the [[Richter magnitude scale|Richter scale]] hits the city of [[Tabas]], [[Iran]] killing about 25,000 people.
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[Saint Vincent and the Grenadines]] join the [[United Nations]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Sabra and Shatila massacre]] in [[Lebanon]] takes place.
*[[1987]] &ndash; The [[Montreal Protocol]] is signed to protect the [[ozone layer]] from [[Ozone depletion|depletion]].
*[[1990]] &ndash; The [[railroad]] between the People's Republic of China and [[Kazakhstan]] is completed at [[Dostyk]], adding a sizable link to the concept of the [[Eurasian Land Bridge]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; The trial of the deposed [[Panama]]nian dictator [[Manuel Noriega]] begins in the United States.
*[[1992]] &ndash; [[Black Wednesday]]: the [[Pound Sterling]] is forced out of the [[European Exchange Rate Mechanism]] by [[speculation|currency speculator]]s and is forced to devalue against the [[German mark]].
*[[1994]] &ndash; The [[Government of the United Kingdom|British government]] lifts the [[1988–94 British broadcasting voice restrictions|broadcasting ban]] imposed against members of [[Sinn Féin]] and Irish paramilitary groups in 1988.
*[[2005]] &ndash; The [[Camorra]] [[organized crime|organized crime boss]] [[Paolo Di Lauro]] is arrested in [[Naples|Naples, Italy]].
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[One-Two-GO Airlines Flight 269]] carrying 128 crew and passengers crashes in [[Thailand]] killing 89 people.
*  2007   &ndash; [[Mercenary|Mercenaries]] working for [[Blackwater Worldwide]] [[Blackwater Baghdad shootings|allegedly shoot and kill]] 17 Iraqis in Nisour Square, Baghdad; all criminal charges against them are later dismissed, sparking outrage in the Arab world.
*[[2013]] &ndash; A gunman [[Washington Navy Yard shooting|kills twelve people]] at the [[Washington Navy Yard|Navy Yard]] in [[Washington, D.C.]]
